Why Mypy?

Mypy is a static type checker for python. If you use annotations while writing the code, mypy can check the code syntax and find common bugs. The annotations that are used in the program do not affect the work-flow of the code and can be considered as hints used in code.
Using python 3 annotation syntax or comment-based annotation syntax for python 2, we can annotate our code and use Mypy to debug common errors. Mypy also helps maintaining and understanding the program easier.

Advantages of mypy:

  • Helps find bugs earlier and with less testing and debugging. Saves a considerable amount of time in a large and complex project.
  • Improves reliability and security, by finding the bugs that are difficult to find.
  • Make programs easier to understand and maintain.
  • We can enjoy the benefits of both dynamic and static typing in a single language. Dynamic typing is flawless for small and simple projects. But as the project grows, we can also adapt static typing for maintenance.
  • Mypy is a free software and can be used for commercial and proprietary projects.


Recent features:

  • We can run mypy with different packages on the command line. For example: mypy --package p.x --package p.y --module z
For more information, follow the mypy blog.


Sources:

  • http://mypy-lang.org/
  • https://github.com/python/mypy
